isis.stitle: ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - DETROIT DIESEL SERIES 60 - 1992 - 1993 - SYSTEM COMPONENTS AND OPERATION - CRUISE AND PTO CONTROLS

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to the Operator's Manual for operating instructions.

Cruise Control operates when vehicle speed is greater than 35 mph and engine rpm is greater than 1200 rpm. Note that the engine speed signal used by the ECM in controlling the cruise system comes from the DDEC sensors. The vehicle tachometer is driven by a International installed engine speed sensor.
PTO controls will only operate when vehicle speed is zero and the vehicle park brake is set (causes the PTO Park Brake Switch (361) to open).

svcsubproc.title: Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (364)
svcsubproc.para: The cruise control brake/clutch relay is used to enable and disable the cruise or PTO controls and the engine brake (if equipped).

Cruise Control - For the cruise control to operate, this relay must be energized. Depressing the clutch pedal, applying the service brakes or setting the park brake will cause the relay to de-energize, disabling the cruise control.
PTO Controls - The PTO operates when vehicle speed is zero AND the Park Brake is set (opening the PTO Park Brake Switch). Releasing the park brake disables the PTO.

note.para: The Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay is a suppressed relay to prevent voltage spikes from entering the electrical system when the relay is de-energized. ONLY replace this relay with the correct part. All relays in International systems are suppressed relays.

svcsubproc.title: Energizing The Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (364)
svcsubproc.para: Ignition power (12V) from F2 10 amp fuse energizes the Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (364) (Refer to Figure 2.01) when:

step1.para: The Clutch Switch is closed (clutch pedal released).
The Service Brake Switch (369) is closed (service brakes NOT applied).
The PTO Park Brake Switch (361) is closed (park brake NOT set).

figure.caption: Figure 2.01 - Ignition Power To The Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay

svcsubproc.para: With the Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay energized, the signal from ECM terminal G2 passes through the relay (NO terminal 87 and common terminal 30) to the Cruise ON/OFF switch (357). Placing the ON/OFF switch in the ON position completes the circuit from G2 to ground, turning the cruise control system ON.

svcsubproc.title: Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (364) De-Energized
svcsubproc.para: To turn the PTO controls ON, this relay must be de-energized by applying the Park brake (PTO/Park Brake Switch (361) is open with park brake set) AND the ECM must see ZERO vehicle speed.

With relay (364) de-energized, the signal from ECM terminal J2 passes through the relay (NC contact 87A and common contact 30) on circuit 97AG to the Cruise ON/OFF switch. Closing the switch completes the circuit from J2 to ground, turning the PTO controls ON.

svcsubproc.title: Clutch Switch
svcsubproc.para: The Clutch Switch is a normally OPEN switch, adjusted to be closed when the clutch pedal is in the released position. The Clutch Switch receives 12V ignition power from F2 10 amp fuse when the key switch is ON. The clutch switch is wired in series with the Service Brake Switch (369), the PTO Park Brake Switch (361) and the Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (364) control coil.

svcsubproc.title: Service Brake Switch (369)
svcsubproc.para: The Service Brake Switch (open when the pedal is released) receives ignition power from 10 amp fuse F2 through the Clutch Switch (clutch pedal released). The ground circuit for the service brake switch is through the PTO Park Brake Switch (361) and the Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (364) control coil.

svcsubproc.title: PTO Park Brake Switch (361)
svcsubproc.para: The Park Brake Switch (open when park brake is applied) receives ignition power from 10 amp fuse F2 through the service brake switch (service brakes released) and the clutch switch (pedal released). With power to the park brake switch, releasing the park brake applies power to energize the Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (364).

svcsubproc.title: Cruise Control ON/OFF Switch (357)
svcsubproc.para: PTO MODE - A signal from the ECM is present at the cruise ON/OFF switch whenever the key switch is ON position. When the Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (364) is not energized, the signal to the ON/OFF switch is from ECM terminal J2 enabling the PTO operation mode.
CRUISE CONTROL MODE - With the Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (364) energized, the signal to the ON/OFF switch is from ECM terminal G2, enabling the Cruise control mode.
When the cruise switch is in the ON position, the ground path from ECM terminal J2 or G2 is completed, turning on either the PTO or Cruise Mode.

svcsubproc.title: Momentary Cruise Control Selector Switch (358)
svcsubproc.para: The momentary cruise control selector switch receives signals on four circuits from the ECM. When the Cruise Control ON/OFF switch is in the ON position, the ground path for the four circuits is through the ON/OFF switch to the ECM power connector to ground at the negative battery terminal.

item.para: Depressing the SET ON switch completes the circuit between ECM terminal J1 and ground.
Depressing the SET OFF switch completes the circuit between ECM terminal B1 and ground.
Depressing the RESUME ON switch completes the circuit between ECM terminal G3 and ground.
Depressing the ACCEL RESUME OFF switch completes the circuit between ECM terminal F2 and ground.

svcsubproc.title: Vehicle Speed Sensor (374)
svcsubproc.para: The vehicle speed sensor is a dual coil sensor with two leads (two wires in each lead). The speed sensor is located at the rear of the transmission. One speed sensor lead sends a variable AC signal through the engine harness (circuits 97AJ and 97AK) to ECM terminals E2 and E3. The other lead sends a variable AC signal through the chassis and cab harness to the speedometer/tachometer unit located in the instrument panel.
